  • Sampler1D

Class Sampler1D

By default the axis is unknown

example
const meca = require("@youwol/mechanics")

class Algo {
    constructor() {
        this.a_ = 0
    }

    set a(v) {this.a_ = v}
    get a()  {return this.a_}

    run() {
        console.log(this.a_)
    }
}

const algo = new Algo()

const sampler = new meca.Sampler1D()
sampler.configure(algo, 'x', 'a', {n: 10, min: 0, max: 1})

sampler.forEach( p => {
    algo.run()
})

Methods

checkAxis

  • checkAxis(): void

  • Returns void

configure

  • configure(parent: any, property: string, params?: { max?: number; min?: number; n?: number; reverse?: boolean }): boolean

  • Configure the axis as a member variable given by its name (property)

    example
    const sampler = new Sampler1D()
    sampler.configure(object, 'cohesion', {n:10, min:0, max:1, reverse:false})

    Parameters

    • parent: any

      The object supporting the property (e.g., object['pressure'], where object is the parent and pressure is the property)

    • property: string

      The property name of this derived class

    • params: { max?: number; min?: number; n?: number; reverse?: boolean } = {}
      • Optional max?: number
      • Optional min?: number
      • Optional n?: number
      • Optional reverse?: boolean

    Returns boolean

forEach

  • forEach(cb: Function): void
  • example
    this.forEach( (_: any) => {
       const value = this.compute()
    })

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

      a function callback

    Returns void
